name: Loguetown Execution Platform
aliases: The Platform of the Pirate King
description: The legendary wooden execution platform in the center of Loguetown where Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King, was publicly executed 22 years ago. The platform stands as a monument to Roger's death and the beginning of the Great Pirate Era.
significance: This is one of the most historically significant locations in the One Piece world. It's where Gold Roger's final words sparked the Great Pirate Era, and where Luffy nearly died in a parallel to Roger's execution.

keyEvents.description: Luffy climbs onto the execution platform to see where the Pirate King died.
Buggy traps Luffy in a stockade on the platform, preparing to execute him in the same manner as Roger.
Luffy smiles in the face of death on the platform, mirroring Roger's final moments.
Lightning strikes the execution platform, destroying it and freeing Luffy.

statusChangeDescription: The platform was destroyed by a lightning strike during Buggy's attempted execution of Luffy.

name: Loguetown
aliases: The Town of the Beginning and the End
description: A bustling town in the East Blue, known as 'The Town of the Beginning and the End' because it's where Gold Roger was born and executed. It's the last stop before entering the Grand Line.
significance: Loguetown serves as a symbolic transition point where many pirates stop before entering the Grand Line, following in Roger's footsteps.

keyEvents.description: Alvida and Buggy prepare their ambush for Luffy in Loguetown.
Smoker captures Buggy and Alvida in Loguetown using Seastone nets.
Dragon appears in Loguetown during a storm to help Luffy escape.
The Straw Hats successfully escape from Loguetown toward the Grand Line.

name: Going Merry
nameJapanese: ゴーイング・メリー号
description: The Straw Hat Pirates' first ship, a caravel given to them by Kaya.

keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats board the Going Merry and escape Loguetown, sailing toward the Grand Line.
